subparagraph.name: A

subparagraph.name: B
ii
subparagraph.leadIn: which may be reasonably required for the purposes of enabling or assisting the Council to perform its functions or exercise its powers under this Ordinance and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, in relation to all or any of the following matters—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the relevant activity authorized by the licence;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the premises to which the licence relates;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the persons to whom the licence applies;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: such particulars as may be required to enable the Council to comply with any regulations made under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: specifying a class of premises to which any premises specified in an application for a licence are required to belong;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: specifying the maximum period or periods of storage of embryos, gametes or other biological material used or to be used for the purposes of a relevant activity, including specifying the means of disposal of such embryos, gametes or material;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: the receipt of a complaint about an applicant for a licence, a person responsible under a licence or the licensee;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the investigation into a complaint referred to in paragraph (h);

paragraph.name: j
k
paragraph.content: the procedure to be followed in lodging a complaint referred to in paragraph (h), an investigation referred to in paragraph (i) or an inquiry referred to in paragraph (j).

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of regulations which may be made under subsection (2)(a), conditions referred to in that subsection may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit, except in such circumstances, if any, as are specified in the regulations—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the storage of an embryo or gametes, or the use of an embryo or gametes for the purposes of a relevant activity, after the death of any person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for whom the embryo or gametes, as the case may be, is or are stored; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: who provided the embryo or gametes, as the case may be; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the alteration, for the purposes of a relevant activity, of the genetic structure of an ovum, sperm or embryo; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: specify a period or occurrence after which a class of embryos or gametes specified in the regulations may no longer be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: stored; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: used for the purposes of a relevant activity.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of regulations which may be made under subsection (2)(h), (i), (j) or (k), such regulations may specify a committee (which may be a committee required by Schedule 1 to be established) to receive a complaint referred to in that subsection, to carry out an investigation referred to in that subsection, and to make a report to the Council as to the outcome of the investigation together with a recommendation as to the course of action the committee thinks the Council should take in view of the report.

subsection.leadIn: Any regulations made under this section may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: empower the Council to grant exemptions from the regulations, either generally or in any particular case;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for a particular case or class of case;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be made so as to apply only in such circumstances as are specified in the regulations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: provide for an appeal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to such person or body as may be referred to in, or established under, the regulations;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: against any decision made under the regulations by the Council; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by any person aggrieved by any such decision made in respect of him;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: provide for the better carrying into effect of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: provide for such incidental, consequential, evidential, transitional and supplemental provisions as are necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving full effect to this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Any regulations made under this section may prescribe offences in respect of contraventions of the regulations and may provide for the imposition in respect of any such offence of a fine not exceeding level 6 and of imprisonment for a period not exceeding 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty not exceeding $1,000.

subsection.def: In this section, daily penalty (按日罰款) means a penalty for each day on which the offence is continued after conviction therefor.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule 1 or 2
section.content: The Secretary for Health may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1 or 2.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), where, immediately before the relevant day, there is an individual under whose supervision a relevant activity is being lawfully carried on in any premises, then, on and after that day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that activity shall be deemed to be authorized to be carried on in those premises pursuant to a licence (deemed licence) granted to that individual; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that individual shall be deemed to be the person responsible (deemed person responsible),

subsection.continued: and the other provisions of this Ordinance shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Paragraphs (a) and (b) of subsection (1) shall cease to apply in relation to the relevant activity and individual referred to in that subsection immediately upon—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the expiration of 30 days after the relevant day except where the deemed person responsible has, before the expiration of that period, given a notice to the Council stating—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: his name and address for service; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the address of the premises at which that activity is being carried on;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expiration of 6 months after that day except where an application is made to the Council before the expiration of that period for the grant of a licence to authorize the carrying on of that activity in those premises (and whether or not the deemed person responsible is to be designated in the licence for the purposes of section 23(2)(a)); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the determination under section 23(1) of that application,

subsection.def: In this section, relevant day (有關日期) means the day on which section 13 comes into operation*.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Provisions with respect to Council and Committees and their Members

section.name: s1
section.heading: Terms and conditions of appointment of members of Council
section.content: Subject to sections 2 and 3, the Chief Executive shall determine the terms and conditions of appointment of a member of the Council.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Terms of appointment of members of Council

subsection.content: Subject to section 3, a member of the Council shall hold and vacate his office in accordance with the terms of his appointment and shall, on ceasing to be a member, be eligible for reappointment.
A member of the Council, not being a public officer, shall be appointed for a term not exceeding 3 years.
A member of the Council, not being a public officer, may at any time by notice given to the Chief Executive resign his office.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Chief Executive may, etc. in certain circumstances declare office of member of Council to be vacant

subsection.leadIn: If the Chief Executive is satisfied that a member of the Council, not being a public officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been absent from 3 consecutive meetings of the Council without the permission of the Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt or made an arrangement with his creditors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has ceased to be of the capacity by virtue of which he was appointed; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to discharge the functions of a member,

subsection.continued: the Chief Executive may declare his office as a member of the Council to be vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Chief Executive thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office shall become vacant.

subsection.content: If a member of the Council becomes the person responsible under a licence or the licensee, the Chief Executive shall declare his office as a member of the Council vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Chief Executive thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office shall become vacant.

The quorum of the Council shall be not less than half the members thereof for the time being and, while a member is disqualified from taking part in a decision or deliberation of the Council in respect of a matter, he shall be disregarded for the purpose of constituting a quorum of the Council for deciding, or deliberating on, that matter.

subsection.leadIn: All matters for determination at a meeting of the Council shall be decided by a majority of votes of the members present and voting and where there is an equality of votes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairperson;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Chairperson is absent or disqualified as referred to in subsection (1), the deputy Chairperson;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if both the Chairperson and the deputy Chairperson are absent or so disqualified, any other member of the Council presiding,

subsection.continued: shall have a casting vote in addition to his original vote.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Procedure of Council
section.content: Subject to the provisions of this Schedule, the Council shall have power to regulate its own procedure including the manner in which decisions of the Council may be made by a quorum of its members otherwise than at a meeting of the Council.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Committees required to be established
section.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of section 6(1) of this Ordinance, the Council shall, not later than 6 months after this section comes into operation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: establish a committee, to be called in English the “Ethics Committee” and in Chinese “倫理委員會”, to—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: provide advice to the Council on any of those issues, whether in consequence of the committee’s function under subparagraph (i) or otherwise; and

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: establish a committee, to be called in English the “Inspection Committee” and in Chinese “視察委員會”, to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: conduct inspections of premises for the purposes of paragraph (d) of section 23(2) of this Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: make recommendations to the Council in respect of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the grant of licences;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: any conditions to which any licence, or class of licence, may be subject;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: establish a committee, to be called in English the “Investigation Committee” and in Chinese “調查委員會”, to conduct an investigation into any matter which may give rise to the Council exercising any of its powers under section 27(1), (2) or (3) or 29 of this Ordinance.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Chairpersons of committees
section.content: The chairperson of a committee shall be appointed from amongst members of the committee who are also members of the Council.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Provisions of Schedule Not Subject to Delegation

section.name: s8
section.heading: Council not to delegate certain functions and powers
section.content: The Council shall not delegate under section 10(1) of this Ordinance any functions or powers imposed or conferred on it under section 5 or 6.
